text: Bomber from Macon Beverage Outlet. Clear gold medium bodied with soft palate. Aroma of roasted grain and lemon, tastes of corn and malt. Hops finish is excellent.

Pretty, scenty, & smooth - this far exceeded my expectations! Pours cloudy gold w/ a retaining white head & exuberant lacing. The aroma is a nice blend of malt, hop, & a touch floral. The taste is bready w/ just a slight hint of hops. The body is soft & creamy making this highly drinkable. Terrific!

Bottle picked up for 2.50, 1 month after best by date. Unfiltered orange-tan body. Frothy, steady, glass rimming bright white head. Bready, easy drinking...in its not so fresh state it reminds me a lot of a Landbier...mellow earthy tones. Pretty drinkable and mellow. OK.
Pours minutely hazy gold with a fine tan head. Aroma is grainy and thick. Flavour is biting and grainy. Finish is dry and great.

Bomber from The Malt Shoppe, 9/21/16. Clear golden copper, large foamy white head, good retention. Aroma of toasted pale malt, earthy and herbal notes, mild caramel. The taste is toasted malt, citrus hops, dry caramel. Medium bodied, refreshing, moderate carbonation, well balanced.

Bottle stamped best before 16 Dec 2016. Pours gold with a faint haze and a lasting white head. Aroma is hoppy in the way of lemon, flowers, malty in the way of toasted sourdough with a quiet toasted corn effect, but after some time warming it turns out to be DMS (must, cauliflower, creamed corn). In the mouth its medium bodied with chewy, honey-ish sugar and a soft break into a clean finish. A little rough in texture (could probably be lagered longer) and limp in carbonation, and its certainly malt-focused but the noble hop touches are pretty nice.

Pour is a clear golden with a large white head. Aroma is a nice almost raw bread dough malt with some bitter hops. Flavor is more of the nice lager malt it is not as bitter as I thought but there is a decent amount of hops after the swallow. This Is a pretty solid take on the style with a real nice lager malt bill.

Bottle from Brewtopia. Golden with chill haze lasting head and lace. Crackery grassy aroma. Crackery light grainy sweetness with a touch of honey. Medium grassy spicy bitterness in wicked clean bready finish. Light body light fine internal carbo enough to spice up the hops and blend the subtle flavors. Totally FUCKIN EXCELLENT.
Bomber. Pours a clear golden color with a medium white head. A big sweet toast and lemon nose. Smooth, fruity, toast, some caramel. Quite nice. Smooth.
Bomber. Pours clear gold with a thin white head. Aroma of bread, spicy hops, malt. Taste is the same, great balance.
Uinta has brewed another good German style lager. Lots flavor a good balance of malt and hops very drinkable, would recommend.

Bottle. Moderate to heavy grain and straw for the malt, moderate herbs for the hops, light soap for the yeast, with notes of paper in the background. Head is large, frothy/creamy, white, with good lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is sparkling clear amber. Flavor starts slightly sweet and lightly to moderately acidic, then finishes moderately acidic and bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery with a lively carbonation and a lightly dry finish. This Helles is top notch. It rates right up there with the best German Lagers.

Bomber from Craft Beer Kings. Pours bright gold with a white head. Aroma is bready, and its making me think more of garlic than grass. Or grassy garlic? Med body, or nearly. Flavor is bready, and it is grassy - not garlicy!!!!! Im liking this a lot compared to Marzens. Long time since Ive had a Dortmunder. Remembering an imported can in a bar in Tiajuana many decades a go. The can was the real deal! Anyway this is a very drinkable lager.

Bottle from Boise Co-op. Pours out clear golden with towering fluffy head. Pure grainy aroma, taste is malts with a minor hop bite on the back. Nice oily, slick mouth feel. Crisp and clean, very faithful rendition. Heaven!

Clear, golden, and a white head. Fresh grass and light citrus over some sweet cereal malts. Medium thin body with healthy carbonation. Flavor has toasted sweet malts, earthy hops, spicy, and light grass. Finish has a nice spicy bite. Bought this on a whim and sure glad I did. If this were in cans it would be a regular in my fridge. Standout.

It pours crystal clear golden with a white head. The aroma has clean pale malt, some bread and minor earthy hops. It has a medium light body with a minor amount of carbonation. The taste has clean bread, spicy hops, grass and wonderful crispness. This is clean, simple tasting and quite beautiful.

22oz bottle from the brewery 
Pours clear light golden with a small off-white head, light lacing. Aroma of toasted malts, bready and spices. Flavor is bready, crackers and spicy hops 
Good

Poured from a 22 ounce bomber. There is a Bready malt flavor that is very enjoyable. Light sulfur notes, on the high side for me, but not overwhelming. Light hop character, a background note. Tasty easy drinking beer.
Aroma is malts/bread and very spicy/slightly skunky hops. The flavor is bread/malts, light citrus, fruit and a very spicy hop finish.
